benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered: POST Valid Payload: Multiple happy-path scenarios verify 201 Created, JSON response contains added AccountEmail(s), and Location header (TC01, TC03-TC05, TC22, TC26).
Header handling: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment accepted (TC02, TC05, TC13).
Path/account validation: invalid UUID format or missing accountId -> 400; non-existent account -> 404 (TC07-TC09).
Request body validation: malformed JSON, empty body, missing required fields, invalid email format -> 400; extra fields behavior documented (TC06, TC10-TC12, TC17).
Resilience/server-side dependency failures and timeouts mapped to 503; retry logic validated (TC15, TC19, TC25).
Security hardening: SQL injection and XSS attempts rejected (TC23, TC24).
Concurrency behavior validated to avoid data loss/duplication (TC20).
Integration/visibility verified via subsequent GET and downstream propagation (TC26).
Handling of unexpected query parameters captured (TC18).
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No explicit test for posting the same email to the same account twice (expect idempotency or 409/422).
Server Error Handling: No scenario asserting 500 Internal Server Error mapping for unexpected failures.
Content negotiation: No tests for incorrect Content-Type (expect 415) or unsupported Accept (expect 406); response Content-Type application/json not asserted.
Response schema: Inconsistent expectations about array vs object; no strict schema validation of the response body.
Location header semantics: Presence checked, but not validated by following the Location URL and asserting it returns the created resource.
Audit/metadata persistence: No verification that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs/events.
Email normalization/uniqueness rules: No tests for case-insensitive duplicates, leading/trailing whitespace, or canonicalization.
Background declares optional headers as required, which can mask scenarios that omit them.
Rate limiting/429 not covered (if applicable to POST creates).
recommendations: Add a duplicate-submission scenario: post the same email twice to the same account and assert expected behavior (idempotent create or 409/422).
Add content-negotiation tests: send Content-Type text/plain -> 415; send Accept application/xml -> 406; assert response Content-Type is application/json on success/errors.
Introduce a simulated unhandled server exception to assert 500 mapping and error payload format.
Validate response schema against the AccountEmail array definition; align all scenarios to assert array vs object consistently.
Assert Location header correctness by performing a GET on the Location URL and verifying it returns the created AccountEmail.
Verify audit trail: CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded and retrievable via audit APIs or response metadata.
Add normalization tests: emails with mixed case, surrounding spaces, and dot/plus variants; define expected uniqueness rules and outcomes.
Move optional headers out of Background; set only X-Killbill-CreatedBy by default, add targeted scenarios for Reason/Comment.
Consider adding 429 Too Many Requests and idempotency-key handling tests if the platform supports them.
